    Source code for simulator.convergence_layers.DtnOutductBasic

    # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

from .DtnAbstractDuct import DtnAbstractDuct


    [docs]class DtnOutductBasic(DtnAbstractDuct):
    duct_type = 'outduct'

    def __init__(self, env, name, parent, neighbor):
        super(DtnOutductBasic, self).__init__(env, name, parent, neighbor)
        
    def run(self):
        while True:
            # Wait until there is something to transmit
            bundle = yield from self.in_queue.get()
            
            # Log ready to transmit
            self.disp('{} starts transmission', bundle)

            # Transmit the bundle
            while True:
                # Wait while bundle is being transmitted
                # yield self.env.timeout((bundle+1)/self.datarate)     # UNCOMMENT FOR TESTING
                yield self.env.timeout(bundle.data_vol/self.datarate)  # UNCOMMENT FOR SIMULATION

                # If the connection has ended by now, then wait for next contact
                # to this neighbor. When it starts, you have to retransmit, hence the while.
                # NOTE: This model a bundle that does not have time to exit at the convergence layer.
                #       I assume that it will be re-transmitted, as if there was an ARQ mechanism or similar.
                if self.conn.active.is_red: yield self.conn.active.green; continue

                # If you reach this point then the bundle has been transmitted while the connection
                # is active, so you can exit the loop
                break
            
            # Transmit the message through the connection. 
            # This is a non-blocking call since the bundle is out in transit
            self.conn.transmit(self.peer, bundle, self.BER)
            
            # Log exit of convergence layer
            self.disp('{} ends transmission (no propagation delay yet)', bundle)

    def __str__(self):
        return "<BasicOutduct {}-{}>".format(self.parent.nid, self.neighbor)

    def __repr__(self):
        return str(self)
    

# =============================================================================
# === TESTING DtnConvergenceLayer
# =============================================================================
                
if __name__ == '__main__':
    # Imports for testing
    from basic_utils import profileit
    from simulator.utils.DtnTesting import Transmitter, Receiver
    from simulator.connections.DtnScheduledConnection import DtnConnection
    import simpy
    
    # Initialize constants
    SIM_TIME = 500
    
    # Initialize variables
    env  = simpy.Environment()
    env.do_log  = True
    env.monitor = True
    rcvr = Receiver(env)
    conn = DtnConnection(env, rcvr, 5*60)
    clyr = DtnOutductBasic(env, conn)
    clyr.initialize(datarate=0.1)
    xmtr = Transmitter(env, clyr.put, rate=5, blocking=False)
    
    # Run the simulation
    profileit(env.run, until=SIM_TIME)
